Letter ECB President to Mr Marco Valli and Mr Marco Zanni, MEPs, on the expanded asset purchase programme https://t.co/6o3Yk4TSFS (EN) https://t.co/i6C5IfEieV (IT)
Draghi: The only way a monetary union can work is if it has a functioning payment system and that is what Target 2 is
Draghi: Patience, prudence and persistence are still the key words informing and inspiring our monetary policy
Introductory statement Mario Draghi to the press conference https://t.co/b4U0Nit90d
Draghi: Just to be clear on reinvestment, we haven’t discussed it but the capital key remains our anchor
Draghi: A trade war where you have rounds of retaliation and responses would create an entire different climate
Draghi: The exchange rate is not a policy target. There has been an international consensus for decades on refraining from competitive devaluations.
Draghi: Our enhanced forward guidance has been very effective, we see no need to modify our language
Draghi: All countries would benefit from intensifying efforts towards achieving a more growth-friendly composition of public finances
Draghi: Other policy areas must contribute more decisively to raising the longer-term growth potential and reducing vulnerabilities

Draghi: The pass-through of the monetary policy measures since June 2014 continues to significantly support borrowing conditions for firms and households, access to financing – in particular for small and medium-sized enterprises – and credit flows across the euro area

Draghi: The underlying strength of the economy confirms our confidence that the sustained convergence of inflation to our aim will continue in the period ahead and will be maintained even after a gradual winding-down of our net asset purchases
Draghi: While uncertainties, notably related to the global trade environment, remain prominent, the euro area economy is proceeding along a solid and broad-based growth path
Draghi: We continue to expect interest rates to remain at their present levels at least through the summer of 2019
